name.ingredients: 500g chicken (boneless, cut into pieces), 1/2 cup plain yogurt, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 300g spinach (fresh or frozen, thawed and drained), 2 tablespoons ghee or oil, 2 large onions, finely chopped, 2 tomatoes, chopped, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 2-3 green chilies, slit (optional), 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/4 cup cream (optional), Fresh coriander leaves for garnish, Salt to taste.
instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, ground coriander, and salt. Add the chicken pieces and coat them well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

If using fresh spinach, blanch it in boiling water for 2-3 minutes, then blend it into a smooth puree. If using frozen spinach, simply blend it. Heat ghee or oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.
Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil starts separating from the mixture.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground coriander, and salt to the onion-tomato mixture. Add the marinated chicken and cook until it is browned.

Stir in the spinach puree and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the flavors are well combined. If using, stir in the cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.
